identificationModule.briefTitle: Endovascular Thrombectomy for eXtra-Large Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Endovascular Thrombectomy Plus Medical Management Versus Medical Management Alone in Acute Ischemic Stroke Patients With Large Vessel Occlusion and Extra-Large Infarct Core: A Multicenter, Prospective Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Since 2015, many randomized trials have shown that endovascular thrombectomy improve functional outcomes in acute ischemic stroke patients with large vessel occlusion. Recently, five randomized controlled trials (ANGEL-ASPECT \[Endovascular Therapy in Acute Anterior Circulation Large Vessel Occlusive Patients with a Large Infarct Core\], LASTE \[LArge Stroke Therapy Evaluation\], RESCUE-Japan LIMIT \[The Recovery by Endovascular Salvage for Cerebral Ultra-Acute Embolism-Japan Large Ischemic Core Trial\], SELECT 2 \[Randomized Controlled Trial to Optimize Patient's Selection for Endovascular Treatment in Acute Ischemic Stroke\], and TENSION \[The Efficacy and Safety of Thrombectomy in Stroke with extended lesion and extended time window\]) demonstrated the efficacy and safety of thrombectomy for large infarct patients (defined as Alberta Stroke Program Early Computed Tomography Score \[ASPECTS\] ≥3 or infarct core \<100ml). Patients with extra-large infarct core (volume greater than 100 mL, ASPECTS score of 2 or less) were excluded from these trials. Therefore, the efficacy of endovascular thrombectomy in patients with extra-large ischemic burden has not been well studied. The XL STROKE registry is aiming to investigate the clinical outcomes and safety of mechanical thrombectomy in acute extra-large ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: Endovascular thrombectomy
armGroups.description: Patients in this group will be treated with medical management plus endovascular thrombectomy

armGroups.label: Medical management
armGroups.description: Patients in this group will be treated with medical management alone

interventions.name: medical management
interventions.description: Medical management includes IV thrombolysis, antiplatelet, and/or anticoagulation.

interventions.name: endovascular thrombectomy
interventions.description: Endovascular thrombectomy with stent-retriever, local aspiration, angioplasty, and/or stenting.

primaryOutcomes.description: Modified Rankin scale score (mRS): scores range from 0 to 6, with 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death

secondaryOutcomes.measure: independent ambulation (defined as a mRS score of 0-3) at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: Score of 0-3 on the modified Rankin scale
Score of 0-2 on the modified Rankin scale
Score of 0-1 on the modified Rankin scale
using Heidelberg criteria to assess SICH

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: All patients are presented with acute extra-large stroke and large vessel occlusion within 24 hours of time from last known well.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Study Protocol, Clinical Study Report, and Analytic Code will be shared after approval of a proposal from principal investigator 3 years after the trial results are revealed.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: 3 years after the trial results are revealed
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: after approval of a proposal from principal investigator
